definition[0]: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
example[1]: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
example[2]: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
example[5]: Cantor nodded without uttering a word.
definition[2]: to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty
example[6]: The wounded prisoner uttered a groan.
